text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 21.3.5.4.1, added link to IRM 21.5.1.5 regarding research role (view only) CIS access is available for all remote-site users. IPU 22U0545 issued 04-26-2022.
21.3.5.4.6, added new para to review e-4442 Case Notes tab for new notes or actions. IPU issued 04-26-2022.

IRM 21.3.5.4.6, updated e-4442 tab title and required actions. Revised to select Next Case proﬁled to work will be assigned in A status. Added required Case Notes each time referral is accessed and must use Resolution tab when closing.
Editorial changes were made throughout the IRM for clarity. Reviewed and updated plain language, grammar, web addresses, IRM references, and legal references.

IRM 21.3.5, Taxpayer Contacts, Taxpayer Inquiry Referrals Form 4442, dated September 03, 2021 October 1, 2021) is superseded. The following IRM Procedural Update (IPU) has been incorporated into IRM: 22U0545 effective 04-26-2022.
All employees performing account work.
Table of Contents
Referrals Form
) Purpose: This IRM covers the referral of taxpayer inquiries that cannot be resolved during initial contact. This section covers written referrals and on Form
, Inquiry Referral, or Electronic Form
) Audience: The primary users of this IRM are all employees in Business Operating Divisions (BODs) who are in contact with taxpayers by correspondence or in person. (
) Policy Owner: The Director of Accounts Management is the policy owner this IRM. (
) Program Owner: Accounts Management Policy and Procedures IMF (PPI) dividual Adjustments (IA) is the program owner of this IRM. (

) Primary Stakeholders: The primary stakeholders Accounts Management collaborates with: • Small Business/ Self Employed (SB/SE) Service Centers, • Wage and Investment (WI) Service Centers, Submission Processing (SP) • WI Customer Assistance-Relationship and Education (CARE) • WI Return Integrity and Veriﬁcation Operations (RIVO) • Criminal Investigations (CI) (
) Program Goals: Program goals for this type of work are: • Achieve a high customer accuracy rate for phone calls and paper justments requiring Form
referrals • Efficiency in preparation of Form

referral related to account • Continuous assessment for program vulnerabilities and improvement • Effective communication with customers The Accounts Management Program Letter has more information on these goals, as well as IRM
, Accounts Management Guide for Managers. (

) Employees in the Accounts Management (AM) organization respond to taxpayer inquiries and phone calls, process claims, and other internal ment requests. Telephone inquiries and account corrections should be while the customer is on the telephone when possible. If necessary to a referral, sites must ensure that referrals are limited to requirements in IRM
, Taxpayer Inquiry Referrals Form
) Refer to IRM
, Policy Statements for Customer Account Services tivities. (
) The authorities for this IRM include: • Policy Statement
, Service Commitment to Taxpayers Service Program • Policy Statement
, The public impact of clarity, consistency, and partiality in dealing with tax problems must be given high priority • Policy Statement
, Timeliness and Quality of Taxpayer dence • Policy Statement
, One-stop service deﬁned Internal Revenue Manual

Purpose: This IRM covers the referral of taxpayer inquiries that cannot be resolved during initial contact. This section covers written referrals documented on Form 4442, Inquiry Referral, or Electronic Form 4442 (e-4442).
Program Owner: Accounts Management Policy and Procedures IMF (PPI) In- dividual Adjustments (IA) is the program owner of this IRM.
Achieve a high customer accuracy rate for phone calls and paper ad- justments requiring Form
referrals Efficiency in preparation of Form
referral related to account issues Continuous assessment for program vulnerabilities and opportunities for improvement Effective communication with customers
The Accounts Management Program Letter has more information on these goals, as well as IRM 1.4.16, Accounts Management Guide for Managers.

Employees in the Accounts Management (AM) organization respond to taxpayer inquiries and phone calls, process claims, and other internal adjust- ment requests. Telephone inquiries and account corrections should be resolved while the customer is on the telephone when possible. If necessary to prepare a referral, sites must ensure that referrals are limited to requirements outlined in IRM 21.3.5, Taxpayer Inquiry Referrals Form 4442.
Policy Statement
, Service Commitment to Taxpayers Service Program Policy Statement
, The public impact of clarity, consistency, and im- partiality in dealing with tax problems must be given high priority Policy Statement
, Timeliness and Quality of Taxpayer Correspon- dence Policy Statement
, One-stop service deﬁned
) The Wage and Investment Commissioner oversees all policy related to IRM, which is published on an annual basis. (
) The Accounts Management Director oversees the instructions to the employees contained in the IRM content. (
) Accounts Management Policy and Procedures IMF (PPI) Individual ments (IA) Tax Analyst(s) oversees the content in this IRM and acts as a of contact for all Accounts management sites. (
) Managers and leads ensure compliance with the guidance and this IRM for Form
referrals are reviewed and resolved timely. (
) Employees prepare Form
referral requests following procedures in IRM. (

) Program Effectiveness: Program Effectiveness is measured and through: a. Managerial reviews b. Quality reviews c. Quarterly Accounts Management Policy and Procedures IMF (PPI) vidual Adjustments (IA) Tax Analysts review
Managers and leads ensure compliance with the guidance and procedures in this IRM for Form 4442 referrals are reviewed and resolved timely.

Reviews should include correct preparation and technical knowledge. Managers, or their designees, must review the referrals for appropriateness and accuracy as outlined in IRM 21.3.5.4.2.1.1, Preparing an e-4442/4442, and must ensure that referrals in the site queue or assigned to their employees are resolved timely in accordance with IRM 21.3.5.4.6, Resolving Referrals.
Inquiry Referrals Form 4442 21.3.5

) The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) lists rights that already existed in the code, putting them in simple language and grouping them into
rights. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see of Rights, on IRS.gov. (

) A written/electronic referral is initiated (in limited instances) when a inquiry cannot be resolved: • While the taxpayer is still on the telephone • In the Taxpayer Assistance Center (TAC) • By the close of business/or the end of your tour of duty (TOD) on day contact is made
resources that impact internal controls. The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) lists rights that already existed in the tax code, putting them in simple language and grouping them into
fundamental rights. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in accord with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see Taxpayer Bill of Rights, on IRS.gov.

The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) lists rights that already existed in the tax code, putting them in simple language and grouping them into 10 fundamental rights. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in accord with taxpayer rights. See IRC 7803(a)(3), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see Taxpayer Bill of Rights, on IRS.gov.
While the taxpayer is still on the telephone In the Taxpayer Assistance Center (TAC) By the close of business/or the end of your tour of duty (TOD) on the day contact is made

Note: Do not advise the caller the reason for the referral is the end of your TOD. Apologize to the caller and explain that additional research is needed to answer their question. Offer to prepare a referral and advise the taxpayer of the
-day timeframe for a response. If the taxpayer does not want to wait the
-days, suggest they call back and provide the hours of operation.
The initial contact may be received in person or by telephone. See IRM
Electronic Transmission, for information requirements to use e-
application on Account Management (AMS). A written/electronic referral is initiated on Form
, Inquiry Referral, or tronic

). Most referrals are account referrals. These referrals are either: • Kept in the office where they are initiated • Sent to another office/campus/function due to a speciﬁc IRM A correct referral has several steps: a. Identify the taxpayer’s issue by listening to the taxpayer and asking probing questions. b. Determine action needed to resolve the issue, research Integrated Retrieval System (IDRS), and appropriate reference material. c. Determine if you are authorized to complete the action. If you are thorized, determine what function is authorized. d. Take appropriate action. Note: Unless directed by a speciﬁc IRM other than IRM
, Inquiry Referrals Form

, do not prepare a referral (Form if the taxpayer is calling only to check on the status of their claim and does not provide additional information to assist in resolving the case. If you have access to Account Services (AMS), add an issue. If you do not have access to input history item on IDRS. It is not required to input a remark both systems.
Note: See IRM 21.3.5.4.2.1, e-4442 Electronic Transmission, for information and requirements to use e-4442 application on Account Management Services
Unless directed by a speciﬁc IRM other than IRM
, Taxpayer Inquiry Referrals Form

, do not prepare a referral (Form if the taxpayer is calling only to check on the status of their claim and does not provide additional information to assist in resolving the case. If you have access to Account Management Services (AMS), add an issue. If you do not have access to AMS, input history item on IDRS. It is not required to input a remark on both systems.
) An inquiry resolved on-line or by the end of your tour of duty (TOD) is not a referral. (
) A fax from a taxpayer or any written correspondence, whether it is an initial inquiry or related to an existing case, is not a referral. (
) Providing the taxpayer with a telephone number or directing him/her to a Taxpayer Assistance Center (TAC) is not a written referral (as deﬁned in IRM section).
Reminder: Never provide the taxpayer with a telephone or fax number marked for “internal use only”.
An informant call is not considered a referral.
Inquiry Referrals Form 4442 21.3.5
) If a taxpayer indicates he/she has information concerning an Abusive Tax Shelter, provide taxpayer with the number of the Abusive Tax Shelter Hot

) Perform complete research prior to making a referral. Use the appropriate reference material; (IRMs, publications, tax packages/forms, Job Aids, tive Tax Law Assistant (ITLA), Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS), Correspondence Imaging System (CIS)), for current or previously worked related issue(s) and the e-
application on Account Management (AMS) to resolve inquiries. (
) Use the Servicewide Electronic Research Program (SERP) to research SERP provides on-line access to; IRMs, Document
, IRS Processing Codes and Information, tax law publications, tax forms, Lexis-Nexis, IRM dates, Alerts, telephone and fax numbers, and other resources. (

) Inform the taxpayer a referral has been completed in response to his/her inquiry and always provide the taxpayer with an expected response time. the time frame listed in the speciﬁc IRM requiring the referral. If a time not listed, tell the taxpayer he/she will hear from us within
calendar Stress to the taxpayer that we make every effort to respond as quickly as possible. Note: See IRM
, Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Case Criteria, to determine if the inquiry meets Taxpayer Advocate Criteria. Refer to IRM
determine if the inquiry meets Taxpayer Advocate Criteria. Refer to IRM

, Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Guidelines, for additional mation. Prepare a referral in the following circumstances: a. You are not trained to perform the needed resolution. b. A subject-speciﬁc IRM section directs you to prepare Form Inquiry Referral. See Exhibit
, Referral IRM Research List, for list of possible referrals with IRM references. Note: The subject-speciﬁc IRM is the controlling IRM for the topic. Example: IRM

, Refund Research, is the subject-speciﬁc IRM for Refund Inquiry. No other IRM can override procedures ing refund inquiry. c. An open control prevents you from taking action and is not for a Corre- spondence Imaging System (CIS) case or you do not have access to CIS. See IRM
, Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) Identiﬁers, to determine where the open control is located. See the Form

Referral Fax Numbers on SERP under the Who/Where page for a listing of fax numbers by site and function. If the open control is for a CIS case, you have access to CIS and the provides additional information to assist in resolution of the case or the timeframe for working the case has passed, do not initiate a referral. Add the information to the CIS case as a Case Note. Refer to IRM
, Corre- spondence Imaging System (CIS) Procedures, for more information.
21.3.5.4.1 (04-26-2022) When to Prepare a Referral

If the open control is for a CIS case, you have access to CIS and the taxpayer provides additional information to assist in resolution of the case or the timeframe for working the case has passed, do not initiate a referral. Add the information to the CIS case as a Case Note. Refer to IRM
, Corre- spondence Imaging System (CIS) Procedures, for more information.
) See IRM
, Adjustment Guidelines - Research, for additional about open controls. (
) All referrals must be prepared on Account Management Services have AMS access and the question is an account inquiry. (
) A complete Form
Inquiry Referral, must have the entries: • Box
, Employee’s Name • Box
, ID Number • Box
, Received Date and Time • Box
, Location • Box
, Referring To • Box
, Date and Time • Box

, TIN • Box
, Current Address • Box
, Form(s) (IMF optional) • Box
, Plan/Report # (MFT) • Box
, Tax Period • Box
, Processing Campus IMF optional • Box
, Date Filed IMF optional • Box
, Refund/Balance Due • Box
, Caller (Caller’s name) • Box
, Taxpayer’s Telephone Number(s) • Part III Section B, Taxpayer Inquiry/Proposed Resolution
All referrals must be prepared on Account Management Services (AMS) if you have AMS access and the question is an account inquiry.
Note: Boxes 1 through 13 are ﬁlled in automatically when using e-4442.
Reminder: Entries in the remaining ﬁelds must be made as
Include in Part III, Section B, the IRM reference directing the referral, the reason you are making the referral, and a complete description of the taxpay
er’s issue. When a subject speciﬁc controlling IRM for the referral is not located and referring to an open control on a non
CIS case, include the IDRS number of the employee the open control is assigned to and time frame provided to the taxpayer.

If the receiving area does not have AMS, the reviewer must print the referral and fax to the appropriate area. For Form 4442 requiring faxing, include the fax number to the location where the referral is being sent. If a fax number is not provided in the IRM section requiring the referral, use Form 4442 Fax Numbers.
Caution: Include only the facts required to resolve the taxpayer’s issue. Do not in- clude personal opinions.
Note: See IRM 21.3.5.4.1, When to Prepare a Referral, and IRM 21.5.2.3, Adjust- ment Guidelines – Research, for reasons for making referrals.

and your employee identiﬁcation number (or your IDRS number) in block

on a paper referral. When the required information is automatically generated by AMS, it is not necessary reinput the information in the required ﬁeld. Note: If you have access to Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS), you must use your IDRS number. (

, Inquiry Referral, must be reviewed by the manager, referral nator, or designated lead. (

application contains a drop-down menu for IRM required When you pick a referral type from this menu an IRM reference will cally post to the Form
Always verify the IRM reference on the referral correct for the reason you are initiating the referral. When selecting other, must manually input the IRM reference on the form. (

referral inventory. (

ﬁelds for you. You must manually complete all required ﬁelds are not populated by e-
) Route e-

s to one of three inventory queues listed below. • Personal Inventory - Referrals resolved by the close of business (COB). Items in personal inventory move automatically to the review folder if they are not resolved. Once reviewed and accepted the manager, inventory items are directed to the in-house inventory the manager. Example: You are waiting on a fax from a taxpayer and you expect to close the case by COB, prepare and route the e-
to your personal using “Required Systems Unavailable” as the reason for the referral.
Inquiry Referrals Form 4442 21.3.5
Always include your full name in box
and your employee identiﬁcation number (or your IDRS number) in block
on a paper referral. When the required information is automatically generated by AMS, it is not necessary to reinput the information in the required ﬁeld.
Use the Electronic Form 4442 (e-4442) application to prepare, electronically route, review, and work Form 4442 referral inventory.
Personal Inventory

Referrals resolved by the close of business (COB). Items in personal inventory move automatically to the managers review folder if they are not resolved. Once reviewed and accepted by the manager, inventory items are directed to the in
house inventory by the manager.

You are waiting on a fax from a taxpayer and you expect to close the case by COB, prepare and route the e-4442 to your personal inventory using “Required Systems Unavailable” as the reason for the referral. If
time and phone schedules permit, return the call the same day when required systems become available. The referral converts to an referral if not resolved by COB.
In-House Inventory - Referrals prepared when IDRS/AMS/Computer Files On-Line (CFOL) are down, complex issue, lack of training, supervisor/lead call back, or additional research needed.
Note: Do not use “Other (write-in)” as the category for an In-House

Example: You receive an inquiry about the status of an amended claim. The account has a -A freeze, the timeframe has expired, and there is an open control on a non-CIS case. You would select IRM and -A freeze the reason for the referral instead of open control.
Use the drop-down menus to route IRM-directed referrals to the appropriate function, site, and to direct in-house referrals to the correct queue.
Note: Use “Other (write-in)” as the category for an IRM-Directed Referral only when the category is not available in the drop-down menu.

Caution: For non-AM employees, since a request for a change/reinstatement of a Direct Debit Installment Agreement (DDIA) must be received by Compli- ance Service Collection Operation (CSCO) a minimum of
business days before the payment date, all Forms
sent for issues relating a DDIA must be reviewed by the manager or manager’s designee within
hours. See IRM
, Taxpayer Problems with DDIA.
are rejected from CSCO if not received timely. (
) Referrals must be reviewed by the manager or manager’s designee within three (
) business days from the date the referral was initially created or re- submitted for review. (
) Action must be taken by the initiating customer service representative (CSR) on rejected referrals within two (
) business days of the case being rejected..

business days before the payment date, all Forms
sent for issues relating to a DDIA must be reviewed by the manager or manager’s designee within
hours. See IRM

are rejected from CSCO if not received timely.
Referrals must be reviewed by the manager or manager’s designee within three (
) business days from the date the referral was initially created or re- submitted for review.
Action must be taken by the initiating customer service representative (CSR) on rejected referrals within two (2) business days of the case being rejected..

Control all referrals on Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS). Use activity code “4442XX.” The XX represents the campus/office location code of the site where the referral will be worked. When creating an e-4442, Inquiry Referral, the system should automatically generate the Control and Activity Code.
Use case status code “A” if you are preparing a referral and will work it as a personal referral. If you are preparing an e-
, the control auto- matically generates. Use case status code “B” if you are preparing a paper referral to be placed in an In-House Inventory. When creating an e-
, the system automatically generates to case status code “B” for In-House Inventory. When employee selects next case from the e-

system (In-House or IRM required), the case will reassign to the selecting employee in case status code “A”. Use case status code “C” if you are preparing a paper referral and the IRM speciﬁes you are to send it to another office/campus/function or closing a case. When creating an e-
, the system controls the case case status code “B” and assign case to the receiving site’s generic number. When closing a case on the e-
system, the system auto- matically closes the control on IDRS.
must manually update the case status code and category code. These procedures apply to e-

s in the case worker’s personal inventory and closed by close of business (COB). Use the following category codes to identify referrals as appropriate: • TWRR-Telephone generated Written Referrals (Refund). • TWRC-Telephone generated Written Referral (Collections). • TWRO-Telephone generated Written Referrals (Other). • MISC - Use this code anytime you are referring a paper Form

to another office/campus/location. If the case is in inventory, you must manually change the category code to “MISC” and close the control base before referring the paper case. If the case is prepared and

TWRR-Telephone generated Written Referrals (Refund). TWRC-Telephone generated Written Referral (Collections). TWRO-Telephone generated Written Referrals (Other). MISC - Use this code anytime you are referring a paper Form

to another office/campus/location. If the case is in inventory, you must manually change the category code to “MISC” and close the control base before referring the paper case. If the case is prepared and being Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
E

referred to another office/campus/location while on the phone (not going into site inventory), use category code “MISC” and case status code “C”. Cases meeting e-4442 criteria are automatically assigned to category code “TWRO” and case status code “B” when electronically sending to another site.
Note: Use the above category codes to identify referrals. Do not use them with unsolicited correspondence.
When access to systems (e.g., IDRS, CFOL, SERP, etc.) required to resolve a telephone inquiry is unavailable, take the following actions:
(04-26-2022) Required Systems Unavailable

telephone inquiry is unavailable, take the following actions: Exception: If Interactive Tax Law Assistant (ITLA) is unavailable you must complete research using the appropriate reference material. Use Servicewide Electronic Research Program (SERP) for on-line IRMs, tax law publications, tax packages/forms, Job Aids, IRM Alerts, telephone and fax number and other resources instead of creating a tax law referral. a. Advise the caller that, at this time, the systems required for you to them are unavailable. Apologize for the inconvenience. Note: Answer any general questions and remind taxpayers of the self- help methods available at IRS.gov. b. Provide the hours of operation. c. Suggest to the caller that they try calling back at a later time. If the agrees, do not prepare a referral. (
) If the caller prefers that we return their call, take the following actions: a. Complete Form
b. Advise caller that we will contact them within

-days. Reminder: Be sure to accurately document the contact name, number(s) and the best time to call. c. Place the referral in your personal inventory queue. If time and phone schedules permit, return the call the same day when required become available. The referral converts to an in-house referral if not resolved by COB. (
) CSRs using screen reader adaptive software who receive an electronic fax format the software will not read, should contact your Manager. If your Manager is not available, prepare an In-House e-

referral with Issues” as the reason. Advise the caller the fax cannot be read due to technical issues and the caller will receive a call back within the speciﬁed timeframe for the issue. Do not transfer the caller to your agent group. (
) Referrals must be transmitted electronically through the e-
application faxed/hand carried to the referral point within four (
) days. Reminder: The use of EEFax, when available, must be used in lieu of manual faxing. See IRM
, IRS Electronic Fax System.

If Interactive Tax Law Assistant (ITLA) is unavailable you must perform complete research using the appropriate reference material. Use the Servicewide Electronic Research Program (SERP) for on-line access to IRMs, tax law publications, tax packages/forms, Job Aids, IRM updates, Alerts, telephone and fax number and other resources instead of creating a tax law referral.

Exception: If Interactive Tax Law Assistant (ITLA) is unavailable you must perform complete research using the appropriate reference material. Use the Servicewide Electronic Research Program (SERP) for on
line access to IRMs, tax law publications, tax packages/forms, Job Aids, IRM updates, Alerts, telephone and fax number and other resources instead of creating a tax law referral.
If the caller prefers that we return their call, take the following actions:
CSRs using screen reader adaptive software who receive an electronic fax in format the software will not read, should contact your Manager. If your Manager is not available, prepare an In-House e-

referral with “Technical Issues” as the reason. Advise the caller the fax cannot be read due to technical issues and the caller will receive a call back within the speciﬁed timeframe for the issue. Do not transfer the caller to your agent group.
Referrals must be transmitted electronically through the e-4442 application or faxed/hand carried to the referral point within four (4) days.
Reminder: The use of EEFax, when available, must be used in lieu of manual faxing. See IRM 21.2.3.5.5.1, IRS Electronic Fax System.
) Never transmit/route a referral to a functional area unless the IRM directs. (

transmit/route a referral to a functional area unless the IRM directs.

) Before directing taxpayers to a TAC, verify what type of services they are questing. Advise taxpayers that you can usually provide the same level of to service over the phone. For additional information on TAC criteria, see IRM

, Standard Services in a Taxpayer Assistance Center (TAC). Make every attempt to resolve the issue and provide information on the alternative services available on, IRS.gov, if appropriate. (To see a list of alternative tions on IRS.gov, click on Help at the top of the page.) Note: When access to systems (e.g., IDRS, CFOL, SERP) is required to resolve the issue but is unavailable due to dead cycles and/or end of year do not refer taxpayers to TAC office for resolution. TAC offices are also riencing the same system failures and are unable to provide any services for taxpayer resolution. (

) If you cannot resolve the issue, the taxpayer insists on visiting a TAC office it is determined that a face−to−face meeting is needed, verify the issue is scope for Field Assistance. If it is in-scope, advise the taxpayer that is provided by appointment only. Note: The services provided at each TAC are listed on the Contact Your Local Office page on IRS.gov. (

, Customer Service Representative (CSR) Duties, (

application to determine if the referral is correct. All sites Taxpayer Assistance Centers (TAC)) must designate a referral coordinator. (

Upon receipt of the Form 4442, Inquiry Referral, if you have Correspon- dence Imaging System (CIS) access, the case has an open control and new information is being provided, follow the guidance below before rejecting the 4442 back to the origi- nator.• Convert Form 4442 to a PDF and attach, as a ﬁle to the open relevant control on CIS. • Enter a Case Note on CIS to alert the employee. If CIS access is not available, forward the 4442 to the correct person with the open control and leave a note on Accounts Man- agement Services (AMS).

21.3.5.4.6 (10-03-2022) Resolving Referrals
) Work the oldest case ﬁrst when resolving referrals. (
) Select Next Case and the oldest referral you are proﬁled to work will cally be assigned to you in A status. (
) Review the e-
Case Notes tab for new notes or actions. (
) Maintain referrals you are working in suspense until they are closed. Use the e-
Case Notes tab to leave notes each time you access the referral until referral is resolved.
Taxpayer (
) Address each issue and take the appropriate action (e.g., using the proper reference guides, IRM procedures, command codes). (
) Update Accounts Management Services (AMS) or Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) with any actions taken. You must use the Resolution tab on e-
to document actions taken prior to closing the referral. (
) Make every attempt to resolve the case within the time frame given to the taxpayer. (
) You must provide the taxpayer with an interim response (by telephone or in writing) if the response time given to the taxpayer is not met. See IRM
, Referral Procedures. (
) If a lapse of more than
-days beyond normal processing time frames occurred and the case does not meet Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) criteria, as outlined in IRM
, Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) lines, do not generate an additional Form

referral or suggest calling to check on the status of the account. Apologize for the additional delay and reassure the taxpayer we have notated the contact on their account and will notify them when the issue is resolved. (
) Refer taxpayers to TAS when the contact meets TAS criteria and you can’t resolve the taxpayer’s issue the same day. The deﬁnition of “same day” is within
hours. “Same day” cases include cases you can completely in
hours, as well as cases in which you have taken steps within
hours begin resolving the taxpayer’s issue. Do not refer “same day” cases to TAS unless the taxpayer asks to be transferred to TAS and the case meets TAS criteria. Refer to IRM
, Same Day Resolution by Operations. (
) Referrals to TAS are made by completing Form
, Request for Taxpayer Advocate Service Assistance (And Application for Taxpayer Assistance and routing the form to TAS. (
) Select the follow-up button on Account Management Services (AMS) e-

when working a case that cannot be closed immediately. The interim option AMS allows you to enter the follow-up date. The system moves the case to top of your inventory, in bold, on the follow-up date. Examples of when to this option are: • Waiting for information/documents • Waiting for payment or adjustment to post (
) When sending interim letters, enter the date in the “Interim Response Sent” ﬁeld on the Part II tab. (
) Maintain referrals you are working in suspense until they are closed. Use e-
Case Notes tab to leave notes each time you access the referral in suspense. (
) An account referral is considered aged if not resolved before the
th day from the inquiry date. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

) A referral is closed when the taxpayer’s inquiry is resolved and he/she is notiﬁed of the closing action. (
) Notify the taxpayer by telephone or in writing. See IRM
, Required Information for Interim Letters and Closing Letters. (
) A generated notice based on a closing action on an account inquiry serves notiﬁcation if it clearly “responds to” or addresses the taxpayer’s inquiry. (
) After closure, a referral worked on the e-
application is viewable for
days. You have the ability to reopen a case that was worked during this time period.
the taxpayer by telephone or in writing. See IRM Information for Interim Letters and Closing Letters.
